title: Ω Pantheon VU Ω
body:
I read a Rioter's comment on how it is kinda difficult to visually update Pantheon so I thought why not shed some light with ideas! Pantheon is clearly inspired by ancient Greek/Spartan warriors. He resembles the average soldier of that place and era too much imo. 

The thing is, he doesn't have to look 100% like one, imo. He has a few Hellenic skins which you can tweak to look like the average soldier or commander of that time.

**Visual idea, Classic and Myrmidon**
http://i.imgur.com/qj3HEGu.png

This is just an example on how to significantly tweak our Spartan while still retaining the Hellenic elements. (A modification of another game's char).

**Current Classic & Myrmidon for comparison**
http://i.imgur.com/IvPbOtq.png

***
**Abilities**

Passive • The regular with a tiny upgrade: At lvl 12, Pantheon's next basic attack deals 75% extra damage after a succesful block.

Q • Same stats, is now a skillshot that pierces everything (i.e goes through minions and hits the champion behind them)

W • Slight changes, mostly in animation: Instead of jumping he now runs forward really fast and pushes his shield upward knocking his target up.

E • Just an animation upgrade.

R • Same. Wanted to suggest clones with a hoplite formation but it would change him too much.

***
Taunt • "This is TARGOOOON (or Rakkor)" while bashing his shield with the spear.

Joke • "The Rakkor don't joke arRROOOOOUUUUND"! ... "Why am I yelling"?
Joke 2 • "Yes, I'm still a baker"

Extra: **I believe Pantheon needs a voice-over!** Something like Gerard Butler or Sion if we compare it with LoL. A lower, heavier voice.

Panth is indeed based off of Sparta, but Hellenistic ideas that we know of came from Athens. Sparta was the war city of Greece and separate from Athens's ideals even when Greece united under the threat of war by other countries. And, Sparta's culture was focused so hard on their war culture because they had like a 15 to 1 ratio of slaves to Spartans. That means they were outnumbered. They had to be at the constant ready for a rebellion against their own slaves. The fact is, Hellenistic ideas shouldn't be with Panth's design. He also should not be shirtless. He is a warrior based off of the Spartan warriors and, as such, should be clothed in armor as they were. Exposed armor would lose the mighty Spartan warrior feel. He is indeed based off of the Spartan warriors and that's what Riot had in mind when they released him. If they are going to give him a VU, it should stay true to the ideas they had of him when they released him.
